channel.title: Posts on Project 3

item.title: Blog 1
item.description: Here I use common R syntax to produce the word “Merry” as an output. library(reticulate) Happy<-"Merry" Happy ## [1] "Merry" Next, I use Python syntax to produce the word “Christmas” Holidays="Christmas!" print(Holidays) ## Christmas! Reticulate will allow both functions to be used together! print(r.Happy,Holidays) ## Merry Christmas! When using R and python, the two can preform the same functions, but the syntax is different. Reticulate allows for R and Python to communicate together which is pretty cool!
